name: Baku Old City
description: A UNESCO World Heritage site, Baku Old City features ancient architecture, narrow streets, and historical sites like the Maiden Tower and the Palace of the Shirvanshahs.

name: Gobustan National Park
description: Famous for its ancient rock carvings, Gobustan offers a glimpse into prehistoric life, with petroglyphs dating back over 40,000 years.

name: Flame Towers
description: These three skyscrapers are a modern symbol of Baku, resembling flames and beautifully illuminated at night, representing the country's fire heritage.

name: Sheki Khan's Palace
description: An architectural masterpiece, this palace is known for its stunning stained glass windows and intricate woodwork, reflecting the opulence of the Sheki khans.

name: Naftalan
description: Known for its unique therapeutic oil, Naftalan is a spa town where visitors can enjoy oil baths believed to have healing properties.

name: Quba Mosque
description: This beautiful mosque features stunning architecture and is a prominent place of worship, reflecting the rich Islamic heritage of Azerbaijan.

name: Ganja
description: A city with a rich historical background, Ganja is home to the Nizami Mausoleum and beautiful parks, showcasing a blend of culture and nature.

name: Khinalug Village
description: One of the highest and most remote mountain villages in Azerbaijan, Khinalug offers breathtaking views and a glimpse into the traditional lifestyle of its residents.

name: Quba Qəbiristanlığı
description: This Jewish cemetery, one of the largest in the world, is a unique cultural site that reflects the history of the Jewish community in Azerbaijan.

name: Lahij
description: Famous for its copper craftsmanship, Lahij is a picturesque village with cobblestone streets, where visitors can watch artisans at work.

name: Shemakha Observatory
description: One of the oldest observatories in the region, it offers stunning views of the night sky and is a center for astronomical research.

name: The Carpet Museum
description: Housed in a building shaped like a rolled carpet, this museum showcases the rich tradition of Azerbaijani carpet weaving and its cultural significance.

name: Quba Genocide Memorial Complex
description: This memorial commemorates the victims of the 1918 massacre of Azerbaijanis and serves as a poignant reminder of the country's history.

name: Goygol Lake
description: Surrounded by stunning mountains and lush forests, Goygol Lake is a serene spot perfect for hiking, picnicking, and enjoying nature.

name: Shaki Fortress
description: This ancient fortress offers panoramic views of the surrounding landscape and is a testament to the strategic importance of the region throughout history.

name: The Atashgah Fire Temple
description: An ancient Zoroastrian temple, Atashgah features a unique architecture and was once a place of worship for fire worshippers.

name: Kuba Carpet Factory
description: Visitors can explore the traditional carpet-making process and purchase beautiful, handcrafted carpets directly from the artisans.

name: Azerbaijan National Museum of Art
description: This museum houses an extensive collection of Azerbaijani and international art, showcasing the country's rich artistic heritage.

name: Nakhchivan Autonomous Republic
description: Known for its historical sites, including the Mausoleum of Nakhchivan and the ancient fortress of Alinja, this region offers a unique glimpse into Azerbaijan's past.

name: Quba Cherry Blossom Valley
description: In spring, this valley transforms into a breathtaking landscape filled with cherry blossoms, attracting visitors for picnics and photography.

name: Beshbarmag Mountain
description: A sacred mountain in Azerbaijani culture, Beshbarmag offers hiking trails and stunning views from its summit.

name: The Fountain Square
description: A vibrant area in Baku filled with cafes, shops, and fountains, it's a popular gathering spot for locals and tourists alike.

name: Shamakhi Juma Mosque
description: One of the oldest mosques in Azerbaijan, this architectural gem features intricate carvings and a rich history.

name: Khinalug Plateau
description: This remote plateau is known for its stunning landscapes and unique flora and fauna, making it perfect for nature lovers.

name: Quba's Quba-Qusar Nature Reserve
description: This nature reserve is home to diverse wildlife and offers scenic hiking trails through lush forests and mountains.

name: Ganja State Philharmonic Hall
description: A cultural hub in Ganja, this venue hosts various performances, including music concerts and theatrical productions.

name: Khachmaz
description: Known for its historical significance and beautiful landscapes, Khachmaz offers a mix of culture, nature, and local cuisine.

name: The Museum of Miniature Books
description: This unique museum showcases a vast collection of miniature books from around the world, highlighting the artistry and history of bookmaking.

name: Lahij Handicraft Workshop
description: Visitors can engage with local artisans and learn about traditional handicrafts, including pottery and weaving.

name: The State Historical-Architectural Reserve of Sheki
description: This reserve includes several historical sites, offering insight into Sheki's rich architectural heritage.

name: Quba's Quba-Qusar Highway
description: Known for its stunning views, this scenic highway takes travelers through picturesque landscapes and charming villages.

name: Goychay
description: Famous for its pomegranate festival, Goychay is a cultural hub where visitors can taste local delicacies and enjoy traditional music.

name: Quba's Quba Museum of History
description: This museum showcases the history and culture of the Quba region, with exhibits on local traditions and artifacts.

name: The Nizami Mausoleum
description: A tribute to the famous poet Nizami Ganjavi, this mausoleum is an architectural marvel surrounded by beautifully landscaped gardens.

name: The Caspian Sea
description: The largest enclosed inland body of water in the world, the Caspian Sea offers beautiful beaches and a range of water activities.

name: The Fire Mountain (Yanardag)
description: This natural gas fire blazes continuously on a hillside, showcasing Azerbaijan's rich history of fire worship.

name: The Gobustan Museum
description: An extension of Gobustan National Park, this museum provides insights into the ancient rock art and archaeological discoveries of the area.

name: The Tufandag Mountain Resort
description: A year-round resort offering skiing in winter and hiking in summer, Tufandag is perfect for outdoor enthusiasts.

name: The Gabala Shooting Club
description: An international shooting range that hosts various competitions, providing a unique experience for shooting sports enthusiasts.

name: The Ismayilli Region
description: Known for its lush landscapes and diverse wildlife, Ismayilli offers tranquil spots for hiking and exploring nature.

name: The Khinalug Cultural Center
description: A center dedicated to preserving the cultural heritage of Khinalug, offering workshops and exhibitions on local traditions.

name: The Shahdag Mountain Resort
description: A popular year-round resort for skiing, hiking, and adventure sports, surrounded by stunning mountain views.

name: The Baku Boulevard
description: A picturesque promenade along the Caspian Sea, filled with parks, cafes, and attractions, perfect for leisurely strolls.

name: The Ganja Waterfall
description: A beautiful natural waterfall surrounded by lush greenery, offering a peaceful retreat and a great spot for photography.
